name: Capability model
file: ../../raw-data/github/xml/UCISA UK HE Capability model Final v2 ArchiMate Exchange File.xml

elements.name: Strategy & Governance
elements.documentation: All capabilities required to ensure that the organisation is able to develop and maintain its strategic direction, manage continuous improvement, grow and share knowledge and best practice, and comply with external requirements.

elements.name: Business Capability Management
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at understanding, prioritising, delivering and managing the capabilities needed to support the strategy(s) and vision.

elements.name: Quality Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to assess service quality, and determine and monitor quality improvement activities.

elements.name: Change Portfolio Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to govern and manage the entire institution change portfolio - including all programmes, projects and initiatives - their prioritisation and oversight.

elements.name: Enterprise Architecture
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to develop and maintain architectural deliverables to support effective business decision making.

elements.name: Organisational Design
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure that its structures are optimised to support operational excellence and delivery of strategic objectives.

elements.name: Benefits Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to identify, measure and evaluate the anticipated benefits associated with a given change initiative.

elements.name: Programme & Project Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure effective management of programmes and projects.

elements.name: Strategy Management
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at ensuring that the organisation has a coherent, integrated and sustainable vision, mission and strategy.

elements.name: Strategic Plan Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to develop, maintain and review strategic plans in support of its vision, mission and strategy.

elements.name: Strategic Plan Development
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to develop, maintain and review strategic plans in support of its vision, mission and strategy.

elements.name: Business Horizon Scanning
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to review developments within the sector and in the world at large to inform strategic development.

elements.name: Strategic Vision Development
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to develop and maintain a coherent vision for the future.

elements.name: Strategic Reporting
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to report on progress towards delivery of strategic plans and objectives.

elements.name: Corporate Governance
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at ensuring compliance with external regulations and internal policies, including management of risk.

elements.name: Internal Audit & Reporting
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to manage and undertake the internal audit and compliance program.

elements.name: Policy & Regulation Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to develop, manage, maintain and enforce corporate polices, regulations and standards in line with internal and external requirements.

elements.name: Risk Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to assess corporate risk, and to identify and monitor risk mitigation activities.

elements.name: Compliance Monitoring & Reporting
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to monitor and report on compliance with institutional Policies and Standards.

elements.name: Business Continuity Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the development, testing, and maintenance of business continuity plans.

elements.name: Corporate Performance Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to set, measure and assess targets and metrics for key corporate objectives.

elements.name: Commercial Activity
elements.documentation: All capabilities required to ensure that the organisation is able to develop, deliver, support and administer commercial activity.

elements.name: Commercial Delivery
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at the successful fulfilment of the organisations commercial activity commitments.

elements.name: Commercial Activity Output Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the relevant processes are in place to deliver and communicate related time, quality, resource and risks associated to commercial outputs.

elements.name: Commercial Activity Exit Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure all relevant processes are in place to allow the organisation to cease specific commercial activities with the least harmful effect.

elements.name: Commercial Activity Issue Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure that all issues effecting commercial activity are handled speedily and effectively, within legal parameters, with the specific aim of minimising business damage and adverse brand reputation.

elements.name: Commercial Engagement
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at managing the organisations relationship with commercial partners.

elements.name: Commercial Partner Integration & Transition
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to manage assimilation and change in the relationship with commercial partners.

elements.name: Commercial Partner Engagement
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to initially identify, engage with, contract, administer and maintain commercial partners.

elements.name: Commercial Sourcing
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at ensuring that the organisation can effectively identify and assess commercial opportunities.

elements.name: Commercial Opportunity Identification
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure that it can identify potential new commercial opportunities across all sectors in which it is looking to operate.

elements.name: Commercial Opportunity Assessment
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure that it has the relevant measures in place to compare and evaluate commercial opportunities.

elements.name: Commercial Market Analysis
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure that it has in place effective processes for the gathering of information about past, current and future states of the commercial marketplace in which it is looking to operate.

elements.name: Commercial Monitoring
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at scrutinising the effectiveness and performance of all commercial endeavours within the organisation.

elements.name: Commercial Contingency Planning
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure commercial activities can continue in the event of unplanned activities, such as supplier failure, emergency or disaster.

elements.name: Commercial Contract Performance Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the process of systematically and efficiently managing contract execution and analysis for the purpose of maximising financial and operational performance and minimising risk.

elements.name: Commercial Activity Reporting
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the effective reporting of commercial activity performance, good or bad, within the organisation.

elements.name: Research
elements.documentation: All capabilities required to ensure that the organisation is able to develop, deliver, support and administer research.

elements.name: Research Impact
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at maximising and promoting the impacts of research undertaken at the organisation.

elements.name: Commercialise Research Outcomes
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to plan and realise the commercial potential of its research outcomes, including contract and intellectual property management.

elements.name: Non-Commercial Research Impact Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to plan and realise the non-commercial potential of its research outcomes, including for social good.

elements.name: Manage Research Relationships
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to plan, manage and cultivate its research relationships with other organisations, including the management of partner relationships and for knowledge exchange relationships.

elements.name: Research Funding
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at obtaining and managing funds to undertake research projects.

elements.name: Research Funds Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to properly and effectively manage research funds throughout research projects, once secured.

elements.name: Research Funding Identification
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to identify and secure sources of funding necessary to undertake research projects, including grant proposal and bid preparation.

elements.name: Research Opportunity & Planning
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at determining and defining the research programmes and projects that will be undertaken at the organisation.

elements.name: Collaborative Opportunity Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to investigate and support opportunities for research that involve relationships or partnerships with other organisations.

elements.name: Research Programme Development
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to develop its programme of research, including the identification of high-level research goals and themes.

elements.name: Research Opportunity Analysis
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to identify and analyse opportunities and ideas for research programmes and projects.

elements.name: Research Prioritisation
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to determine the priority of potential research programmes and projects.

elements.name: Research Training
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at training and developing the organisation's researchers, including both staff and post-graduate research students.

elements.name: PGR Student Skills Development
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to develop its postgraduate research students so as to equip them with the necessary skills to undertake, defend and publish their research.

elements.name: Researcher Training & Development
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure researchers know what is expected of them and how that contributes to the wider objectives of the organisation. Ensuring researchers are fully equipped, from a skills perspective, to deliver impactful research projects.

elements.name: PGR Supervisor Development
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to develop the supervisory and support skills of those staff who supervise postgraduate research students.

elements.name: Research Publications
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at publishing research findings and reporting outputs.

elements.name: Research Output Reporting
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to develop and produce reports on research outputs, including those necessary to meet the requirements of funding bodies.

elements.name: Research Publication Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to publish and promote research findings, and holistically manage its publication collections to maximise impact.

elements.name: Research Delivery
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at undertaking and delivering the research itself.

elements.name: Research Dataset Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to store, share, use and re-use datasets produced from research projects, including dataset management planning and curation of datasets beyond the lifetime of individual projects.

elements.name: Research Output Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to manage the outputs that are produced from research projects, including curation of those outputs beyond the lifetime of individual projects.

elements.name: Research Production
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to produce research. This is the execution of the research project.

elements.name: Research Improvement
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at the continuous improvement of research quality and performance.

elements.name: Research Programme Performance Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to review and improve the performance of its research programme.

elements.name: Research Quality Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to review and improve the quality of its research activities.

elements.name: Researcher Performance Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to assess researcher performance and undertake performance improvement activities.

elements.name: Research Administration
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at administering and supporting the organisation's research environment.

elements.name: Research Compliance Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to manage and ensure compliance with research rules and regulations, including ethics.

elements.name: Research Infrastructure Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to manage its specialist research infrastructure.

elements.name: Enabling Capabilities
elements.documentation: All capabilities required to ensure that the organisation is able to provide general financial, adminstrative, physical and technical support to the core activities of Strategy & Governance, Teaching & Learning, Research and Commercial Activity.

elements.name: Facilities & Property Management
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at ensuring that organisational facilities and properties are fit for purpose, future-proofed and maintained to the appropriate standards, including security and health and safety.

elements.name: Health & Safety
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to provide an environment conducive to the health and safety of the entire onsite community.

elements.name: Vehicle Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to manage its internal vehicle fleet.

elements.name: Commercial Tenancy
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to manage external tenants.

elements.name: Mail Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the distribution of mail both internally and externally.

elements.name: Campus Parking
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to provide the appropriate level of car parking availability.

elements.name: Property Maintenance
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to maintain its estate to appropriate and acceptable levels.

elements.name: Campus Security
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the safety of the onsite community including monitoring and responding to unacceptable or criminal behaviour.

elements.name: Estate Development & Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure that its estate is effectively developed and managed to meet both current and future requirements.

elements.name: Space Utilisation
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to maximise the utilisation of available space.

elements.name: Environmental Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to manage environmental services.

elements.name: Finance Management
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at the efficient and effective management of money (funds) in such a manner as to allow the organisation to accomplish its objectives.

elements.name: Asset Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure a systematic process of deploying, operating, maintaining, upgrading, and disposing of assets cost-effectively.

elements.name: Financial Reporting
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the accurate and secure preparation, production and publication of financial information for both internal & external consumption.

elements.name: Taxation Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the relevant strategy and procedures are in place to safeguard the organisation against its taxation risks and liabilities.

elements.name: Treasury Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure ongoing liquidity and mitigation of operational, financial and reputational risk through sound financial planning.

elements.name: Expenditure Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the effective payment of creditors, suppliers and customers.

elements.name: Supplier Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to plan and manage the relationships with third party suppliers of goods and services to maximise benefits.

elements.name: Insurance Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the relevant provisions are in place to provide a means of protection from financial loss.

elements.name: Procurement & Purchasing Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the effective sourcing, purchasing and supply of the goods and services that enable the organisation to operate.

elements.name: Income Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the effective invoicing, collection and allocation of monies into the organisation, including debt management.

elements.name: Budget Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the analysis, organisation and oversight of costs and expenditures within the business. This will include adhering to strict internal protocols on income & expenditures.

elements.name: Financial Advisory
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to offer specialist financial advice.

elements.name: Government, Public & Stakeholder Relationships
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at ensuring a continuous level of engagement is maintained between the organisation and its customers, stakeholders & other interested parties.

elements.name: Industry Relationship Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure it effectively establishes, develops and nurtures a network of mutually beneficial industry relationships.

elements.name: Public Relationship Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure it establishes and maintains mutually beneficial relationships between the organisation and the public, through a programme of corporate, annual and one off external-facing events, as well as a programme of collaborative and community-focussed events.

elements.name: Internal Stakeholder Relationship Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure it facilitates, develops and maintains internal stakeholder engagement & dialogue.

elements.name: Other Tertiary Institution Relationship Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to identify key peer tertiary institutions, and manage and maintain these relationships.

elements.name: Government Relationship Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure it effectively manages and maintains its ties with government bodies.

elements.name: Media Relations Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure it promotes and enhances its profile and reputation regionally, nationally and internationally. Through the publicising of research and expertise, achievements and successes to a range of media and networks, while also responding to direct enquires from the press, maximising positive coverage in the media.

elements.name: Promotions Management
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at the promotion of the institution to prospective and current students, businesses and the general public.

elements.name: Marketing Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure it puts into practice the appropriate techniques, methods and structures in order to market the organisation.

elements.name: Brand Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure its brand is perceived positively, presented consistently and segregated from its competition.

elements.name: Campaign Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to raise awareness of its courses and services through planning, execution, tracking and analysis of marketing campaigns.

elements.name: Market Research
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure information is gathered, analysed, understood and disseminated about the market(s) in which it operates, or may operate in future. This includes understanding the needs and preferences of those the organisation aims to serve, and the viability of the services it offers now or plans to offer.

elements.name: Event Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure large scale events, such as open days, conferences and high-profile public lectures, are planned, coordinated and operated satisfactorily.

elements.name: Merchandising
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to promote the sale of products in a retail setting.

elements.name: Information & Communication Technology Mgt
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at the efficient and effective development, delivery and management of ICT resources and access to those resources.

elements.name: End User Computing
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the availability of end user devices and/or access by end user devices.

elements.name: High Performance Computing
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure access to HPC services.

elements.name: Identity & Access Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to manage data on IT systems and applications about users. Managed data includes user objects, identity attributes, security entitlements and authentication factors.

elements.name: Digital Communication Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to facilitate communications between stakeholders over digital channels and ensure that new channels are identified and adopted as required.

elements.name: Infrastructure Lifecycle Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to create and manage infrastructure in support of organisational requirements.

elements.name: Application Lifecycle Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to create and manage applications in support of organisational requirements.

elements.name: ICT Service Support
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the delivery of customer focused ICT service support.

elements.name: Supporting Services
elements.documentation: All activities that provide additional support to staff and students on and off campus to ensure a comprehensive range of services.

elements.name: Internal Communications
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure that all constituent parts can communicate effectively using appropriate means across all aspects of the business.

elements.name: Child Care Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure that there is suitable childcare advice and support available to staff and students. This may include childcare facilities, vouchers, etc.

elements.name: Sport & Recreation Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to provide facilities for sport and other recreational activities to staff, students and the wider community where appropriate.

elements.name: Health Care Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to make sure that efficient and effective health care services are available. It will ensure that students know how to access these services, especially students not from the UK.

elements.name: Venue Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to manage the provision and booking of venues, including the associated facilities, both internally and to external customers. This excludes event management.

elements.name: Food & Retail Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to manage the provision of food and retail outlets and associated services on campus and at associated locations. This includes payment services, e-commerce, stock management and logistics.

elements.name: Complaint & Compliment Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to receive, manage and respond to any complaints or compliments related to any aspect of its business.

elements.name: Religious Support
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to support the religious and spiritual needs of staff and students, including the provision of care services, events and facilities.

elements.name: Printing Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to provide print services to students and staff, including provision of accounts for payment when required and printing in custom sizes and formats.

elements.name: Library Management
elements.documentation: All activities related to the management of library resources and access to those resources. This does not include the physical library environment.

elements.name: Library Membership Mgt
elements.documentation: What the Organisation does to manage membership of the library, covering students, staff and the wider community.

elements.name: Library Collection Resource Mgt
elements.documentation: What the Organisation does to manage the its library collections and resources, including acquisition, invoicing and cataloguing, covering both physical and electronic assets.

elements.name: Library Collection Access Mgt
elements.documentation: What the Organisation does to manage loaning and access to library collections and resources both physical and electronic, by students, staff and the wider community, in line with license and subscription agreements.

elements.name: Art/Museum Collection Mgt
elements.documentation: What the Organisation does to manage, maintain and secure its art and museum collections, including acquisition, cataloguing and loans.

elements.name: Information Management
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at acquiring, storing, exploiting, archiving and deleting information in the organisation. Information under management includes structured and unstructured data as defined as in scope by the data governance, data security and data management policies.

elements.name: Information & Data Security Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to assess, mark, monitor, manage and maintain information security,  and intervene/escalate in the event of breach of the Information Security policy. This will include complying with regulation, legislation and internal risk management.

elements.name: Business & Operational Reporting
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to understand requirements, source data, validate quality and publish reports – on any platform – to underpin its daily operations and support its tactical and strategic planning.

elements.name: Information & Data Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to manage institutional data, including planning for sourcing and storage, ensuring data is fit for purpose including sourcing and maintenance of data necessary to support the organisations business (may include geospatial, social, economic, demographic data).

elements.name: Copyright Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to secure data under copyright, including identification, assessment, monitoring and intervention in the case of breach, and ensuring appropriate use of data copyrighted by other persons or organisations.

elements.name: Enterprise Content Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to acquire, maintain and manage content across both digital and physical platforms.

elements.name: Information Search & Discovery
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to locate, index, catalogue and publish information for both internal and external use. This may include data not held by the organisation.

elements.name: Knowledge Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to acquire, enrich, share, store, publish and enhance the expertise across the whole organisation.

elements.name: Information Collection Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to understand, acquire, store archive and delete/sunset information which requires collection, validation, quality checking, use and re-use.

elements.name: Records Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure that that records are managed in accordance with internal and external requirements / regulations / law.

elements.name: Information Analytics
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the application of appropriate analytical techniques, including support for advanced analytics and their application to large data sets, providing the organisation with greater insight into their data.

elements.name: Legal Services
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at ensuring the availability of effective legal services.

elements.name: Legal Advisory
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to provide effective legal advisory services to its community.

elements.name: Contract Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure that all contracts are effectively managed within required frameworks.

elements.name: Dispute Resolution
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to manage and resolve legal and legislative disputes.

elements.name: Legal & Legislative Compliance
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure compliance with all appropriate legal and legislative requirements.

elements.name: Accommodation Management
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at the provision of accommodation to students, and potentially other people when not occupied by students.

elements.name: Accommodation Departure & Turnaround Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to enable an orderly departure of residents at the end of their tenancy and ensure the accommodation is properly prepared for its next resident.

elements.name: Accommodation Incident & Emergency Response
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure it is able to react and respond appropriately to emergencies and other serious incidents that occur in or affect student accommodation, including the ability to keep residents safely housed even during occurrences that mean standard accommodation is temporarily vacated.

elements.name: Private Sector Housing Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to provide tools and services to help students find private accommodation to rent whilst they are at the organisation.

elements.name: Accommodation Facilities Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure accommodation is appropriately furnished and equipped, including repair and replacement of furnishings and equipment as needed.

elements.name: Accommodation Allocation
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to allocate accommodation to students who have requested it, or to other people staying there when not occupied by students, and to enable an orderly occupation of accommodation upon arrival, and the management of room transfers and student withdrawals.

elements.name: Human Resource Management
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at the management and organisation of staff and their contribution to the institution.

elements.name: Talent Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure succession planning, assessment, development and high-potential management of people particularly valuable to the organisation.

elements.name: Staff Recruitment
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the best candidates are recruited to vacant posts, including identification of job requirements, attraction and selection of candidates, hiring and induction.

elements.name: Workforce Reporting
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure it provides internal and external (including statutory) operational and strategic information about its workforce to those who need it.

elements.name: Occupational Health
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the physical and mental wellbeing of its employees in the workplace.

elements.name: Remuneration & Entitlements Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure it rewards its staff appropriately in terms of pay, pension and other benefits.

elements.name: Employee Performance Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure expectations of employee performance are set, and individual objectives are established and assessed. This includes ensuring measures can be put in place to manage and improve unacceptable performance.

elements.name: Staff Engagement
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure its employees are motivated to contribute to the organisation's success and committed to the organisation’s goals and values.

elements.name: Workforce Relations Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure a positive work environment, focus on individual and collective relationships, including unions, resolve workplace issues through intervention when necessary.

elements.name: Employee Support
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure its employees are provided with assistance, advice and guidance about personal and employment matters that might affect health, wellbeing or performance.

elements.name: Staff Record & Details Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to maintain accurate information about employees, including contact, address and biographical details, contract management and document management. This includes appropriate record retention and disposal management.

elements.name: Training & Development
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the acquisition of new, or enhancement of existing, knowledge and skills by its employees in order to provide the desired level of performance.

elements.name: Staff Absence Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the absence of employees is managed, recorded, authorised and followed up appropriately, along with ensuring work is adequately covered by other staff. This includes annual, sick, and other authorised leave, and unauthorised absence.

elements.name: Workforce Planning
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to forecast, recommend and report workforce requirements and performance, including structuring, based on the strategic objectives of the institution.

elements.name: Teaching & Learning
elements.documentation: All capabilities required to ensure that the organisation is able to develop, deliver, support and administer teaching and learning and the student experience.

elements.name: Student Completion & Graduation
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at conferring degrees (and other awards) to students who have qualified appropriately and hence become graduates.

elements.name: Graduation Eligibility Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure that the administrative and financial (debt) affairs of students are in order, and those eligible to graduate are determined. This does not include academic results or exam/review boards.

elements.name: Graduation Event Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to stage the ceremony at which degrees are formally and publicly conferred by the organisation to eligible graduands. This includes the abilities to make the necessary arrangements for the event(s), and the carrying out of the graduation ceremony itself along with other associated events.

elements.name: Non-Academic Achievement Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the recognition and recording of achievements made by students at organisation, other than formal academic awards. This includes abilities to produce HEARs (Higher Education Achievement Reports), recognise outstanding extra-curricular activities and voluntary work, and to bestow intuition-specific prizes.

elements.name: Graduation Record Certificate Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure accurate records, relating to the formal qualifications awarded to students, are produced and maintained. This includes degree award certificates, Diploma Supplements and other associated certificates and records, and the ability to provide records and certificates as required.

elements.name: Student Administration
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at maintaining accurate records of students and their administrative and academic statuses during their time at organisation, and managing the change of records and statuses.

elements.name: Programme Transfer Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure a student's enrolment on one programme can be ceased, and enrolment onto an alternative programme performed, within limitations that may be imposed in terms of time, academic requirements, fees or other administrative reasons.

elements.name: Student Record & Details Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to maintain accurate information about students, including contact, address and biographical details, and document management. This includes appropriate record retention and disposal management.

elements.name: Student Exceptional Factors Misconduct / Appeal Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure it can receive and process student submissions relating to mitigating circumstances, investigate and act in response to student misconduct, or allegations thereof, and handle subsequent formal challenges to those findings or actions. This includes ensuring the appropriate formal frameworks are in place for dealing with such situations. The term 'misconduct' can relate to academic offences, administrative discrepancies or behavioural conduct.

elements.name: Student Mobility
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure students can study and enrol at different universities, either as part of their award at the originating organisation or as a permanent transfer to the other organisation, and, vice-versa, the ability to accept students from other universities in the same fashion.

elements.name: Enrolment Status Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the change of students' official statuses as members of the organisation in response to requests or changes in situation, and in accordance with the relevant regulations. This includes the abilities to interrupt/suspend studies for a period, withdraw from units of study, programmes of study and/or the organisation, and to transfer between units/modules of study.

elements.name: Student Financial Administration
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure that all aspects of student finance are effectively managed, including fee setting and collection and debtor management.

elements.name: Academic Administration
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at managing academic policies, regulations, scheduling and related customer feedback.

elements.name: Academic Policy & Regulation Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to create, review, administer and revise Academic policies and regulations.

elements.name: Academic Year Scheduling
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to schedule the curriculum across the academic year.

elements.name: Timetabling Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to manage the creation, revision and communication of the timing and location of curriculum events, including lectures, seminars, examinations and all similar/related activities.

elements.name: Student Enrolment
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at ensuring that students are fully enrolled at the programme and module level and inducted into the organisation community.

elements.name: Student Induction Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to introduce the student to the organisation and its communities, including activities which are intended to support students in making key transitions throughout their programme of study and/or life.

elements.name: Module Selection Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure that students are fully enrolled on the necessary modules for their programme of study, including pre-enrolment where appropriate and provision of full information to enable informed module choice.

elements.name: Programme Enrolment
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure that students are fully enrolled on their chosen programme of study, including provisional enrolment, confirmation, and capture of all necessary personal details.

elements.name: Teaching & Learning Delivery
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at delivering a learning experience to students of the organisation and enabling them to engage with learning in the subjects as described in the curriculum. This includes the delivery of teaching activities as well as other activities that support a meaningful learning environment.

elements.name: Non Presence Based Teaching
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to provide teaching activities via online and digital channels that enable learning for students not physically located with the teaching content provider.

elements.name: Student Placement Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to source, allocate and manage the placement of students in learning and professional practice environments external to the organisation as part of the curriculum.

elements.name: Presence Based Teaching
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to provide face to face teaching activities that enable learning and associated resources, to students physically located with the teaching content provider.

elements.name: Teaching & Learning Content Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to provide resources in a wide range of formats to support learning and teaching in the organisation. This includes physical and digital resources such as the VLE and lecture capture, access to specialised space, library and other physical and digital services.

elements.name: Student Admission Management
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at managing student applications, placement offers and quotas.

elements.name: Offer, Acceptance & Quota Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure student offers are distributed, acceptances are processed and quotas are managed, including confirmation activities.

elements.name: Student Application Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure student applications are assessed/evaluated, including assessment of prior learning, scheduling interviews and clearing activities.

elements.name: Student Attraction & Recruitment
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at planning and delivering campaigns and events that aim to recruit and convert undergraduate and postgraduate students to the organisation.

elements.name: Student Recruitment Agent Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the effective management of external agents involved in the recruitment of students.

elements.name: International Student Recruitment
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the effective recruitment of prospective international students to agreed targets.

elements.name: Prospective Student Engagement
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to engage with, and promote the organisation to, prospective students.

elements.name: Scholarship & Bursary Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure scholarships and bursaries are set, assessed, managed and awarded.

elements.name: Domestic Student Recruitment
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the effective recruitment of prospective domestic students.

elements.name: Curriculum Management
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at educators and administrators collaborating on the creation, development, design, review, approval, assessment, and refinement of curriculum content to achieve desired student outcomes.

elements.name: Curriculum Change Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure educators and administrators collaborate on the review and refinement of curriculum components to achieve desired student outcomes.

elements.name: Curriculum Retirement Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure educators and administrators withdraw & retire curriculum components.

elements.name: Professional Learning (Staff)
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to support the enhancement of the student learning experience through initial and continuing professional development of Academic staff.

elements.name: Curriculum Design
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure educators and administrators collaborate on the creation, development, design, approval and release of new curriculum components to achieve desired student outcomes.

elements.name: Curriculum Performance Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to develop and support the organisation's quality assurance framework e.g. Academic Committees, Annual programme monitoring, Periodic programme review, Course Approval & modifications etc.

elements.name: Curriculum & Resource Development
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure that the relevant resources are available to deliver the curriculum components e.g. learning spaces, books etc.

elements.name: Professional Accreditation
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the academic curriculum is accredited by a professional authority.

elements.name: Student Support & Wellbeing Management
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at ensuring students receive adequate support and advice throughout their time at organisation.

elements.name: Housing Advice
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure students have access to the support and advice required to enable them to secure accommodation that suits their needs and budget, whether that be organisation halls or private accommodation.

elements.name: Career & Employability Engagement Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to engage with prospective employers and to ensure students are provided with direction and careers advice in order to help them develop and realise their career ambitions and to maximise their employment prospects.

elements.name: Academic Advice Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure academic advice is provided for students, including insight, direction, and planning of their academic career.

elements.name: Student Health & Wellbeing
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to assist students with their health and wellbeing, including the provision of student wellbeing advice, mental health advice and counselling.

elements.name: Student Engagement & Retention
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure students are pro-actively engaged in the learning process and want to continue their studies at the organisation.

elements.name: Academic Skills Development
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure students are assisted with their academic skills development, including development of skills in research, use of library resources, academic writing, work planning and critical thinking.

elements.name: Personal Learning Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure students requiring additional support receive an individual personal learning plan to help them achieve their short and long term goals.

elements.name: Personal Tutor Provision
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure delivery of personal tutoring to students to help them make a successful transition into H.E. and aid their academic progression and achievement, including provision of academic and personal support and guidance, and signposting to other support services.

elements.name: Student Financial Advice
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure students receive the help they need to manage their finances, including providing advice and guidance on financial matters and providing access to hardships funds if required.

elements.name: Disability Support Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure students who disclose a disability or require additional support for their academic studies receive  the support  and advice they need to achieve their full potential.

elements.name: Student Assessment
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at assessing whether a student has achieved the learning outcomes of the curriculum.

elements.name: Assessment Marking & Feedback
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to mark, benchmark and moderate assessments, and provide feedback to students that facilitates their development as learners.

elements.name: Student Results Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to manage the gathering, aggregation and assignment of a student's results from a variety of assessment methods (including coursework, examinations and placements) as part of their curriculum and in accordance with academic regulations to provide assessment outcomes (e.g. progression and award).

elements.name: Assessment Administration
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to administer the assessment of students, ensuring regulations, policies and processes are followed, and that there is a clear communications strategy so students are aware of the assessment regime and their responsibilities.

elements.name: Assessment Delivery
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure that students are assessed against the learning outcomes of their curriculum proportionately and using the most appropriate assessment method.

elements.name: Alumni Engagement
elements.documentation: All activities aimed at Alumni engagement ensuring the organisations alumni is fully involved in the life of the institution as valued supporters, advocates, and lifelong learners who contribute to, and benefit from, connections to each other and to the organisation.

elements.name: Benefactor Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure effective engagement with potential / actual benefactors. Benefactors may provide financial donations or other help.

elements.name: Alumni Relationship Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the effective communication and interaction with past students of the organisation.

elements.name: Alumni Event & Campaign Mgt
elements.documentation: What the organisation does to ensure the development and management of alumni related events and campaigns.
